author: ESPN com
title: El impacto de Santiago 2023: Cifras positivas en lo econÃ³mico y un rÃ©cord histÃ³rico de medallas para el Team Chile - ESPN
text: Santiago 2023 ha sido uno de los desafÃ­os mÃ¡s grandes que ha vivido Chile como paÃ­s organizador. El magno evento de los Juegos Panamericanos transcurriÃ³ durante 19 dÃ­as de competencia, dejando cifras en cuanto a lo econÃ³mico y lo deportivo que superaron las expectativas. El Team Chile registrÃ³ su mejor actuaciÃ³n histÃ³rica, donde superÃ³ las 50 medallas de Lima 2019, para sumar un total de 79 preseas en la competiciÃ³n que reuniÃ³ a cerca de 6.500 atletas de 41 paÃ­ses. Si bien en un comienzo hubo ciertas dudas con hechos puntuales que fueron noticia, como la gotera en el Polideportivo de ViÃ±a del Mar en pleno partido de balonmano femenino, el balance general en cuanto a infraestructura tambiÃ©n dejÃ³ un buen sabor de boca. Las sensaciones fueron tan positivas que, en su minuto, Harold Mayne-Nicholls, director ejecutivo del evento, planteÃ³ la opciÃ³n de aprovechar estos recursos para una postulaciÃ³n futura a una candidatura olÃ­mpica: "No postular a los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos serÃ­a un error histÃ³rico", afirmÃ³. LA COSECHA DE MEDALLAS En lo estrictamente deportivo, de esas 79 preseas obtenidas por la delegaciÃ³n chilena, 12 fueron de oro, 31 de plata y 36 de bronce, sumatoria que posicionÃ³ a Chile en la octava ubicaciÃ³n del medallero general. Dentro de las disciplinas mÃ¡s destacadas, se luciÃ³ el karate, con representantes nacionales que lograron el oro como Rodrigo Rojas (+84kg Masculino), Enrique VillalÃ³n (-60kg Masculino) y Valentina Toro en los -55kg Femenino. Asimismo, el remo, con tres oros, tanto en hombres como mujeres, y el patinaje, con gran actuaciÃ³n de Emanuelle Silva, tambiÃ©n dejaron su marca de chapa dorada. Francisca Crovetto (Tiro), Emile Ritter (Salto masculino de EsquÃ­ acuÃ¡tico), Lucas Nervi (Lanzamiento de disco masculino), Santiago Ford (DecatlÃ³n masculino), Martina Weil (Atletismo 400m femenino), tambiÃ©n se distinguieron por cuenta propia tras lograr el mÃ¡ximo objetivo. Entre las medallas de plata mÃ¡s sobresalientes estuvo la de Kristel KÃ¶brich, la incombustible nadadora que estuvo muy cerca del oro en los 1500m libres femenino, un hito que rompiÃ³ todas las marcas de la nataciÃ³n en Chile y lo hizo a sus 38 aÃ±os. Por su parte, los tenistas nacionales TomÃ¡s Barrios y Alejandro Tabilo tambiÃ©n aportaron lo suyo, pero cayeron en la final del dobles masculino y, en el caso de Barrios Vera, tampoco pudo ganar la definiciÃ³n en singles, por lo que culminÃ³ con dos platas a su haber. Otra de las Ã¡reas que destacÃ³ fue el fÃºtbol, tanto en su rama femenina como masculina, donde ambas selecciones tuvieron que ceder el oro luego de caer en sus respectivas finales, frente a MÃ©xico y ante Brasil. VENTA DE TICKETS Y DIVIDENDOS ECONÃ“MICOS Los nÃºmeros finales para la CorporaciÃ³n Santiago 2023 fueron absolutamente favorables. De un total de 1 millÃ³n 600 mil boletos disponibles, se distribuyeron 1.327.894 tickets, de los cuales mÃ¡s de 800 mil se fueron vÃ­a venta directa y los restantes fueron repartidos como entradas de cortesÃ­a y otros compromisos contractuales. AdemÃ¡s, hubo deportes de libre acceso, por lo que, segÃºn los organizadores, mÃ¡s de un millÃ³n 400 mil personas pudieron observar los Juegos en directo. Todos estos registros se unieron al soporte de las 34 marcas tradicionales y los ocho partners institucionales que participaron de en los panamericanos, donde la mayorÃ­a de los ingresos se recaudaron a travÃ©s de canjes (US$ 16.044.439 netos), equivalentes al 78,9% del total. Y sobre el dinero en efectivo, la cifra fue de 4.278.454 dÃ³lares, principalmente por la venta de entradas. NÃºmeros que se tradujeron, de acuerdo al comitÃ© organizador, en que cada dÃ³lar invertido se calculÃ³ en 1,18 dÃ³lares de retorno para la economÃ­a en Chile. En relaciÃ³n a las disciplinas que congregaron mayor asistencia de pÃºblico, se distinguiÃ³ en primer lugar el atletismo, con 279.630 (39.947 mil en promedio); seguido del fÃºtbol, con 255.350 (7.073 por dÃ­a) y el vÃ³leibol piso, con 206.549 (9.389 espectadores a diario). En el evento, ademÃ¡s, sobresaliÃ³ la labor de los voluntarios, con 10.886 personas que colaboraron en la organizaciÃ³n, varios de ellos extranjeros de paÃ­ses como PerÃº, Argentina y Brasil. Finalmente, en cuanto a la recaudaciÃ³n para los atletas, casi $1.000 millones fueron repartidos para los medallistas chilenos, un merecido premio en reconocimiento al talento, la trayectoria y el trabajo invertido durante aÃ±os que pudo ver sus dividendos en un aÃ±o de gran cosecha para el deporte nacional.

author: Cristina Valdivieso
title: El Ayuntamiento de Sevilla impulsa un programa para combatir a los mosquitos
text: El Ayuntamiento de Sevilla incrementarÃ¡ en los prÃ³ximos meses los programas de prevenciÃ³n, caracterizaciÃ³n y vigilancia sobre las poblaciones de mosquitos para minimizar su impacto en la salud de la ciudadanÃ­a en cumplimiento de los planes de vigilancia requeridos tanto desde la administraciÃ³n central como de la autonÃ³mica y despuÃ©s de que se hayan registrado ya los primeros casos de virus del Nilo en humanos en la provincia, uno de ellos, con resultado de muerte, asÃ­ como la detecciÃ³n de mosquitos infectados en hasta seis municipios. AsÃ­, a travÃ©s de la delegaciÃ³n de Comercio, Consumo, Salud, Cementerio y ProtecciÃ³n Animal, el gobierno local ha impulsado un plan para controlar enfermedades que transmiten estos insectos, que se va a desarrollar desde el 1 de agosto, y hasta el prÃ³ximo mes de noviembre, en aquellas zonas de la ciudad donde puede darse una mayor concentraciÃ³n de vectores que se caracterizan por ser vehÃ­culo de transmisiÃ³n, fundamentalmente, del virus del Nilo Occidental. Se trata de una actuaciÃ³n que se enmarca dentro del I Plan EstratÃ©gico Andaluz para la igilancia y Control de Vectores ArtÃ³podos con Incidencia en Salud (PEVA), aprobado el pasado mes de abril, en concreto, en su apartado de competencias municipales en el marco de la protecciÃ³n de la salud de sus vecinos mediante la prevenciÃ³n, vigilancia y el control de vectores de incidencia sanitaria. El programa, a cuyas prescripciones tÃ©cnicas ha tenido acceso este periÃ³dico, se divide en tres partes. Por un lado, la identificaciÃ³n entomolÃ³gica larvaria mediante el trampeo de mosquitos, asÃ­ como su cuantificaciÃ³n, cartografiado y geolocalizaciÃ³n en al menos ocho puntos diferentes y representativos de la ciudad, donde sea mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil predecir el desarrollo del vector, con una periodicidad de aproximadamente 20 dÃ­as. Por otro, se harÃ¡ una bÃºsqueda de hÃ¡bitats refugios de los estados adultos de mosquitos y su captura para obtener informaciÃ³n relevante para alcanzar objetivos como la toma de decisiones en el control integrado de vectores y la evaluaciÃ³n de las medidas correctoras adoptadas. Por Ãºltimo, las muestras de mosquitos se conservarÃ¡n para su estudio molecular, que se llevarÃ¡ a cabo en hembras de la misma especie, recogidas a la vez, en el mismo punto de muestreo y que se organizarÃ¡n por lotes de hasta 50 mosquitos por dÃ­a, trampa y especie. La idea es estar preparados para lo que pueda venir. Las enfermedades transmitidas por vectores constituyen una amenaza creciente en todo el mundo, debido principalmente a la globalizaciÃ³n, con el movimiento constante de personas y mercancÃ­as por todo el planeta, junto al aumento de las temperaturas y las modificaciones de la pluviosidad, factores estos Ãºltimos asociados al cambio climÃ¡tico. AsÃ­ todo, aunque el plan estratÃ©gico andaluz tiene como objetivo principal la gestiÃ³n eficiente de los problemas sanitarios humanos y de sanidad animal relacionados con zoonosis transmitidas por vectores artrÃ³podos en AndalucÃ­a, fundamentalmente mosquitos, garrapatas y flebÃ³tomos, lo cierto es que surgiÃ³ tras el grave brote de fiebre del Nilo Occidental que afectÃ³ a AndalucÃ­a en el 2020, con especial incidencia en la provincia sevillana, con cuatro vÃ­ctimas mortales. Como primera acciÃ³n, en el 2021 se puso en marcha el â€œPrograma de Vigilancia y Control Integral de Vectores de la Fiebre del Nilo Occidental\", enfermedad transmitida por mosquitos, que ahora queda incorporado al nuevo plan estratÃ©gico andaluz PEVA y que obliga a las corporaciones locales a desarrollar planes de control y vigilancia de vectores de incidencia sanitaria. El Plan contempla tener identificados a los agentes y entidades implicados en el desarrollo del mismo, con sus responsabilidades y competencias, garantizar la colaboraciÃ³n adecuada y fluida, permitiendo una gestiÃ³n eficaz de las enfermedades de transmisiÃ³n vectorial bajo el liderazgo de la administraciÃ³n sanitaria y la implementaciÃ³n de actuaciones locales programadas para la prevenciÃ³n efectiva. La implementaciÃ³n de actuaciones locales programadas para la prevenciÃ³n efectiva de estas enfermedades es vital para la protecciÃ³n de la salud de la poblaciÃ³n y para ello el plan establece la puesta en marcha y ejecuciÃ³n de las medidas de prevenciÃ³n y control previstas en los planes de control de plagas implantados por la administraciÃ³n local, en funciÃ³n del nivel de riesgo de transmisiÃ³n por zonas; la adopciÃ³n y, en su caso, intensificaciÃ³n de acciones especÃ­ficas a nivel local en materia de vigilancia, control y comunicaciÃ³n de manera urgente ante la presencia de agentes patÃ³genos; y la elaboraciÃ³n de instrucciones concretas para la aplicaciÃ³n de medidas de salud pÃºblica urgentes por enfermedad o grupo de enfermedades, la gestiÃ³n de los brotes y la comunicaciÃ³n del riesgo.

author: Peter Hassett
title: Fourth-line heat: Caps beat Kings 4-3
text: The Washington Capitals hosted the road-experts Los Angeles Kings for a Sunday matinee. Against one of the best possession teams in the league, the Caps did better than youâ€™d think. Well, actually â€“ how exactly did you think theyâ€™d do? Nic Dowd scored first, a backhander assisted by Aube-Kubel. Adrian Kempe got LA on the board by banking the puck off Fehervary and then the post. Kevin Fiala scored on a rebound that wasnâ€™t Darcy Kuemperâ€™s best, but Dylan Strome tied it again after a passing sequence with Pacioretty and Ovechkin. Fiala scored again early in the third, on the power play. Aube-Kubel loosed a sneaky wristshot to tie it with 11 minutes left in regulation. Late in the game, John Carlson weaved through a bunch of skaters to give the Caps the win. Caps win! Max Pacioretty picks up his first point with the [@Capitals]with an assist on this goal by Dylan Strome ( [@stromer19])! ðŸ¦… Does Strome have your vote to be an [#NHLAllStar]? Have your say âž¡ï¸ [https://t.co/JOMxUndKd8] [#NHLAllStarVote]presented by [@massmutual] [pic.twitter.com/MuBwZ1amkq] â€” NHL (@NHL) [January 7, 2024] Some audacious pattern-mixing [#joebsuitofthenight] [pic.twitter.com/w9TmBJHkQA] â€” RMNB (@rmnb) [January 7, 2024] The Caps now get a three-day break. Itâ€™s their first since the Christmas holiday and their last until the All-Star Break. That is a lot of time, and all of it will be needed for these players to recover and their tactics to get tuned. Then again, next game is against the Kraken. Might as well throw Ovi-Kuzy out there again and hope the fourth line will save the day. Headline photo: kurly from [Crashers](https://www.patreon.com/rmnb) [RMNB](https://russianmachineneverbreaks.com/about) is not associated with the Washington Capitals; Monumental Sports, the NHL, or its properties. Not even a little bit. You are free to share, copy, and remix this content so long as it is attributed, done for noncommercial purposes, and done so under a license similar to this one.

author: CBS Chicago
title: New CPR guidance could save more lives - CBS Chicago
text: Drowning is a leading cause of death for children in the U.S. between the ages of 1 and 4. Until recently, guidelines for CPR have focused on chest compressions to save drowning victims, but now, the American Heart Association and the American Academy of Pediatrics say rescue breaths are also critical. Michael George reports.

author: Alba Ventura
title: Ã‰DITO - Ã‰tudiants juifs exfiltrÃ©s Ã  l'UniversitÃ© de Lille : "Est-ce qu'il est encore possible de supporter cela ?", rÃ©agit Alba Ventura
text: Deux jeunes militants juifs de gauche ont Ã©tÃ© victimes de censure Ã  l' [UniversitÃ© de Lille](https://www.rtl.fr/actu/politique/universite-de-lille-le-gouvernement-va-deposer-plainte-contre-jean-luc-melenchon-7900379378), mardi 21 mai, Ã  l'occasion d'une table ronde organisÃ©e sur le thÃ¨me "IsraÃ«l-Palestine : comment une communautÃ© universitaire s'engage ?". Ces deux Ã©tudiants sont membres du Golem, un collectif de militants juifs de gauche qui dÃ©nonce l'antisÃ©mitisme autant que la politique guerriÃ¨re du [Premier ministre israÃ©lien Benjamin Netanyahu ](https://www.rtl.fr/actu/international/les-infos-de-18h-gaza-que-risquent-netanyahu-et-des-dirigeants-du-hamas-apres-la-demande-de-mandats-d-arrets-7900386200)qualifiÃ© de "fasciste" qui "massacre des civils gazaouis". On peut aisÃ©ment avancer qu'il s'agit de jeunes gens trÃ¨s ouverts Ã  la discussion, Ã  l'Ã©change, qui ne sont pas du tout dans la radicalitÃ© et qui ne sont pas dans le rejet, bien au contraire. Mardi soir, ils ont pourtant subi, selon leurs termes, "une humiliation antisÃ©mite publique" dans un amphithÃ©Ã¢tre de 200 personnes. Parmi ces 200 personnes : des enragÃ©s, des haineux, des sectaires, des Ã©tudiants pro-palestiniens les ont insultÃ©s Ã  coups de "sionistes", "soutiens de Netanyahu", "colons", "soutiens du gÃ©nocide Ã  Gaza". Les deux jeunes membres du Golem ont Ã©tÃ© bÃ¢illonnÃ©s, rÃ©duits au silence. Pour les protÃ©ger, la facultÃ© a dÃ» envoyer des agents de sÃ©curitÃ© qui se sont postÃ©s devant eux puis les ont escortÃ©s et exfiltrÃ©s. Est-ce qu'il est encore possible de supporter cela ? Ã€ quel moment cela va-t-il s'arrÃªter ? Jeudi 23 mai, la direction de Science po Paris a dÃ©cidÃ© de traduire 8 militants propalestiniens en commission de discipline. C'est tout ? Et tous les autres ? Ã€ l'universitÃ© de Lille, on a bien sÃ»r dÃ©noncÃ© les mÃ©thodes et les comportements, mais la fac osera-t-elle poursuivre tous les fauteurs de troubles ? Que vont dÃ©cider la ministre de l'Enseignement, le Premier ministre ? Quand on combat pour la libertÃ©, on ne peut pas Ãªtre faible. author: OVB online
title: â€žHabe mich blenden lassen": VerkÃ¤uferin nach â€žBares fÃ¼r Rares"-Expertise geschockt
text:
â€žHabe mich blenden lassenâ€œ: VerkÃ¤uferin nach â€žBares fÃ¼r Raresâ€œ-Expertise geschockt
Nicht alles, was aussieht wie eine RaritÃ¤t, ist auch eine solche. Die neueste Ausgabe von â€žBares fÃ¼r Raresâ€œ beweist das einmal mehr. Die verhinderte VerkÃ¤uferin sah sich in der ZDF-TrÃ¶delshow mit einer teuren Fehlinvestition konfrontiert.
â€žDas ist ja ein Ding!â€œ, rief â€žBares fÃ¼r Raresâ€œ-Kandidatin Maria, nachdem Dr. Friederike Werner ihre Expertise vollendet hatte. Was in der ZDF-TrÃ¶delshow oft ein Ausdruck der Freude ist, spiegelte in der aktuellen Dienstagsfolge nur blankes Entsetzen wider. Was hatte die VerkÃ¤uferin derart irritiert?
Noch beim Vorab-Interview berichtete sie vor der ZDF-Kamera, dass sie auf dem Antikmarkt â€žganz begeistertâ€œ von der Lampe gewesen sei - und sie fÃ¼r mehrere hundert Euro gekauft hatte. Zu Hause angekommen passte sie aber nicht so recht zur Einrichtung. Nun sollte sie also weitergereicht werden. Ob es so weit kommen wÃ¼rde?
Der Start war vielversprechend: â€žArt dÃ©co - da steh ich voll draufâ€œ, frohlockte Moderator Horst Lichter, als er die Katzenleuchte erblickte. â€žSo schÃ¶n die Katze auch ist, die Lampe finde ich nicht so hÃ¼bschâ€œ, erlÃ¤uterte Maria, selbst Besitzerin einer Siamkatze, den Wunsch, sich von dem Tier zu trennen. Im Netz sei sie dieser Art Katze oft begegnet, aber immer ohne die Lampe. HÃ¤tte sie das stutzig machen kÃ¶nnen? Stolze 480 Euro hatte sie jedenfalls fÃ¼r das Objekt auf dem Antikmarkt hingeblÃ¤ttert.
â€žSagen wir es mal so: Der Stempel ist vortÃ¤uschend gemeint.â€œ
Dr. Friederike Werner begann mit ihren ErlÃ¤uterungen und fand eine Signatur, die Michel Decoux als KÃ¼nstler der Katzenskulptur auswies. â€žWir sind im Art dÃ©co, was auch die kubistischen, strengen Linien verdeutlichen.â€œ Dann kam das verheerende Aber: â€žNur der Entwurf stammt aus 1920er-Jahren, nicht aber die AusfÃ¼hrungâ€œ, musste die Expertin feststellen. â€žDer KÃ¼nstler war so beliebt, dass er oft nachgegossen worden ist.â€œ Das zeigte unter anderem die Farbe. Sie datierte das Bronze-Objekt auf die Jahre 1980 bis 1990.
Und was besagte der Stempel? â€žDer GieÃŸereistempel erinnert in seiner Form an Stempel aus dem 19. Jahrhundert, ist aber nicht echt.â€œ Eine weitere BestÃ¤tigung, dass die Lampe nur ein Nachguss war. â€žSagen wir es mal soâ€œ, setzte die Fachfrau zum Fazit an. â€žDer Stempel ist vortÃ¤uschend gemeint, als sei es ein altes Objekt.â€œ
Horst Lichter Ã¼bergibt keine HÃ¤ndlerkarte
Das wiederum rief Horst Lichter auf den Plan. Der â€žBares fÃ¼r Raresâ€œ-Gastgeber musste zur Tat schreiten: Da es sich nicht um eine RaritÃ¤t handelt, sondern um nachgemachte Ware, musste er die schlechte Nachricht Ã¼berbringen, dass er keine HÃ¤ndlerkarte vergeben durfte.
â€žKrassâ€œ, schnaufte da die verhinderte VerkÃ¤uferin. Die EnttÃ¤uschung war Maria und ihrer Begleitung groÃŸ, zumal sie fast 500 Euro fÃ¼r die Lampe gezahlt hatte. â€žIch habe mich blenden lassenâ€œ, zeigte sie sich am Ende ihres Auftritts in der ZDF-TrÃ¶delshow zerknirscht. (Dieser Artikel entstand in Kooperation mit teleschau.)

author: Campbell Clark
title: The Rings Of Power Season 2 Premiere Episodes Review - I'm Not Sure Who This Show Was Made For?
text: Itâ€™s time for my The Rings of Power Season 2 premiere episodes review, and I do wonder who this show was made for? More on that in a bit, first off, let me explain how this is going down. For one, Iâ€™m a Tolkien book fan and someone of the opinion that if you are changing what the Professor wrote, it better be damned good. Thatâ€™s the point of view I cannot help but come from personally. I donâ€™t think this show is aimed at fans like me, thatâ€™s just me being honest. That being said, I think perhaps there is a demographic that this show is perfect for. I just think thatâ€™s a fairly niche market compared to others. Iâ€™m also going FULL SPOILERS in this series folks. That means if you havenâ€™t watched it yet, you may want to check back later. If you donâ€™t care about spoilers for a story thatâ€™s literally older than me in reality, then read on. Episode 1 Episode 1 was actually my least favourite of the three opening episodes. Part of this is the burden this episode has in dealing with some of the odd choices made in Season 1. We begin with a scratch record moment as we see the events that preceded and into Season 1 from Sauronâ€™s point of view. Thereâ€™s good and bad here. The bad: OG Sauron didnâ€™t work for me, wrong actor chosen and the form he would choose to command Orcs I donâ€™t see being that one. Sauron gets Caesarâ€™ed it makes little sense to me. Adar knows what Sauron is, therefore he is surely aware he cannot just be killed. This is hardly the first body Sauron lost in the story up to this point under his service to Morgoth. Clunky, poorly scripted, obvious and far too dark to see anything unless you are in a movie theatre. The good: Once Sauron was dead I liked his resurrection. It worked for me that it took tome and energy to speed the process along. Sauron could have simply existed incarnate though for a while. Fly away, take time to for a new body, etc. I donâ€™t like the idea that that sludge is all thatâ€™s left of his â€˜spiritâ€™. But I do like that crafting a physical body would take time. The ugly: So we are not getting an answer for why Sauron was on that boat in Season 1. He randomly follows some mortal dude talking about going off coast to new lands. Sauron knows thereâ€™s no land (Numenor is new and he doesnâ€™t know about it) West of Middle-earth they can go. You just get the feeling the writers never worked out this plot hole until the criticisms came after Season 1â€™s finale. Letâ€™s Change Tolkienâ€™s Ideas So, we have a show set in the Second Age, the Age Tolkien wrote least about. This show works best when it just tries to visualise what Tolkien wrote or it is making up story Tolkien never wrote about. Where it seems to struggle is when they change something Professor Tolkien spent many more hours than them reasoning out. What is the one subject Tolkien was most explicit about when it comes to the Second Age? The Rings, where they came from and how they were passed along. What is the one thing the shows writers keep messing with? Ergo the decision to reverse the order of all the Rings save the One, which began in Season 1, proves once again to have been a bad call. Now the Three are around, the show has to invent ways to create certain events. The answer for this show is to have the Elves learn Sauron helped Celebrimbor make the Three. This causes so many issues down the line that will need to be resolved. It could have all been avoided simply by going with Tolkienâ€™s chronological order, even if you are squashing millennia into a few years. Now the show needs to have the Seven created for the Dwarves and the Nine created for Men, which was never the idea. The show also has to create a new reason for the attack on Eregion because the book story no longer can work. In the books Sauron only openly attacks in rage at the Elves removal of all the Rings, Mixed with his anger that Celebrimbor created Three he didnâ€™t know of. Itâ€™s the Three he didnâ€™t know about which were never factored into his plans. GRADE: C+ It looks a million dollars and I like the actors, This show does everything correct except the overall story being told. Episode 2 Okay, so I wasnâ€™t crazy about Episode 1 and the second episode is a little better. Thereâ€™s still plenty of plot lines that feel needless, but at the same time we get some actual storytelling. The Rhun story with the Stranger, who they keep linking to Gandalf and the dark Wizard, who they are playing too close to Saruman so far, is actually interesting. What works is the complete lack of story from Tolkien. In The lore, there were two Istari (Wizards) who went East. Tolkien initially decided that both fell from the path and went on to establish magic cults in the East that probably outlasted Sauron. However, in later years he changed his mind and decided the two Blue Wizards succeeded. The show seems to be trying to tell this story and mix both version of the lore. In other words Ciarin Hinds Wizard is the one who turned evil. The Stranger therefore is the one who stayed true. So far so good, though Iâ€™ll stress they could destroy this promising storyline by calling the Stranger Gandalf and the dark Wizard Saruman. Iâ€™ve already wrote about why this would be awful. For now though, I like it because it adds to Tolkienâ€™s lore rather than changes it. Though, I will need the dark Wizard to be a more developed character than the moustache twirling silent type weâ€™ve seen so far. Gotta give that time though which is fine. RELATED: [The Questions I Want Answered In Rings Of Power Season 2](https://lrmonline.com/news/the-questions-i-want-answered-in-rings-of-power-season-2/) Few things I noticed though which annoyed me in episode 2 and 3, Distance is dictated by scene order in the script, not logic. Sauron rides from Mordor to Eregion and it takes him less time than it does for the Stranger and Poppy to walk about 5 miles. Meanwhile, messengers from Lindon to Eregion, which is far, far closer take longer to arrive and then get killed by randomâ€¦something on the way. That was a weird scene and felt crammed in last minute to explain why the messengers didnâ€™t arrive. Cirdan has a beard pre-Ring bearer and does not afterwards. Yet we are not told why? Did it make him younger? Oh and how Sauron knows whatâ€™s going on elsewhere when he is shown to have no spies and currently in a full body? That being said, the scene where Sauron reveals himself as Annatar to Celebrimbor was excellent and frankly you canâ€™t blame him for falling for it. I mean, Sauron is a literal angel messenger, he just wasnâ€™t sent by anyone. I disliked Sauron suggested Rings for Men and Dwarves, but I already commented on why above. It is another needless deviation from the established chronological story of the Rings. GRADE: B For the Rhun plot and Annatar scenes. Episode 3 Keeping this as simple as possible, as Iâ€™ve already bored half my readers. I like the Numenorean politics but thereâ€™s a few issues. In some ways the show feels like itâ€™s drawing inspiration from the political wrangling of Game Of Thrones. Yet, the show also feels like itâ€™s trying to show Numenoreans as being better than that. I think you kinda have to pick one. So far, the show hasnâ€™t done a good enough job of explaining the politics of the Pharazon camp. Why are they so anti-Elves despite their own heritage. Donâ€™t get me wrong, this happened in the books also and led to the downfall of Numenor. I just donâ€™t think the show has done a good enough job of showing the audience why. The Dwarves are always great but again nothing too controversial is changed and there was never much written about them in the first place. In fact, as per season 1 I really like the Dwarves story in this show. Though straight to another moan about Geography and jump cuts. Arondir saves Isildur in a scene thatâ€™s already been released online. No major issues with that scene although Arondir seems to be like the Neo of Elves compared to what we see of the others. However, he gives Isildur a choice to follow him or not and walks a very short distance. We get a wipe and Arondir is now standing at Bronwynâ€™s funeral pyre in Pelargir. The distance they walked in one wipe whilst no tome passed elsewhere is staggering. It also just looked weird to cut it like that. Place another scene in between and you build a sense that time has passed. GRADE: B- Better than Episode 1â€¦. Wrap It Up Hereâ€™s the thingâ€¦ I have no idea who this show was made for? It seems to me, Rings of Power is targeted at folks who only ever watched the movies, but didnâ€™t get bored during the extended editions. Did you like the theatrical movies, but found them long? If you are someone who didnâ€™t care about the extended editions or found them too long, then Rings of Power is too slow paced for you. If instead you are a Tolkien book fan, and have read the Silmarillion, youâ€™ll just be bamboozled at how badly some of the stories have been muddled. In other words,, this show is not for book nerds. However, itâ€™s also not for the casuals who care not for accuracy but just want to see some fantasy action. Thatâ€™s two big demographics who just wonâ€™t care for Rings of Power. So who does that leave to watch the most expensive show ever made? For the money spent on this, and how good it looks and was cast, it should have been made for book fans. Season 1â€™s story was far too slow and too much of a waste of time. Sadly, the mistakes in plot from Season 1 are carrying their issues over to Season 2 as well. Overall Grade for First 3 Episodes: B- What did you think of my The Rings of Power Season 2 premiere review and what did you think of the show yourself. Do you fall into any of the categories I mentioned in my wrap up, if so which one? Thoughts below. [](https://endeavor-comics.com) [FOR FANBOYS, BY FANBOYS Have you checked out LRM Onlineâ€™s official podcasts and videos on The Genreverse Podcast Network? Available on YouTube and all your favorite podcast apps, This multimedia empire includes The Daily CoG, Breaking Geek Radio: The Podcast, GeekScholars Movie News, Anime-Versal Review Podcast, and our Star Wars dedicated podcast The Cantina. Check it out by listening on all your favorite podcast apps, or watching on YouTube! Subscribe on:](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCS7fo8v5tr_-U0i3rlYfRWQ) [Apple Podcasts](https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/los-fanboys-podcast/id1082156294?mt=2)| [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/show/084cvmiweF4j7gAcN1KN8Q)| [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/los-fanboys)| [Stitcher](https://www.stitcher.com/podcast/lrm-online)| [Google Play](https://play.google.com/music/listen?u=0#/ps/I4pownqgznmgceslfqzkwuwxoxq)

author: @bfmbusiness
title: Un fabricant amÃ©ricain de drones signe son plus gros contrat avec l'armÃ©e franÃ§aise
text: En attendant son drone "made in France", l'armÃ©e franÃ§aise fait ses emplettes Ã  l'Ã©tranger pour Ã©quiper ses unitÃ©s. Le dernier contrat en date a Ã©tÃ© passÃ© Ã  AgEagle. Cette entreprise amÃ©ricaine a annoncÃ© dans un communiquÃ© un contrat de 3,4 millions de dollars (3,15 millions d'euros) pour une cinquantaine de drones. "C'est le contrat le plus important de notre histoire", assure AgEagle dans son communiquÃ©. Pour les Commandos parachutistes de l'Air Cette commande comporte 40 eBee VISION et une dizaine dans une autre gamme, Ã  priori le eBee TAC, un drone tactique cyber-sÃ©curisÃ©. Elle serait destinÃ©e pour les Commandos parachutistes de l'Air (CPA) de l'armÃ©e de l'Air et de l'Espace. Le eBee Vision est un modÃ¨le lÃ©ger (1,6 kg) Ã  voilure fixe (1,20 mÃ¨tre d'envergure) conÃ§u pour le renseignement, de surveillance, de reconnaissance, mais aussi pour des missions de sÃ©curitÃ© civile. "Ce contrat valide notre stratÃ©gie dans l'adaptation de nos systÃ¨mes Ã  ce type de missions", a dÃ©clarÃ© Bill Irby, PDG d'AgEagle Le Vision est un UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System pour aÃ©ronef non habitÃ©) mis au point pour les forces spÃ©ciales. Il permet de dÃ©tecter, de suivre et de gÃ©olocaliser des unitÃ©s terrestres de jour comme de nuit grÃ¢ce Ã  une camÃ©ra thermique. Il retransmet des images en direct jusqu'Ã  une distance de 20 kilomÃ¨tres avec une autonomie de 90 minutes. C'est un drone sÃ©curisÃ© qui affiche une faible signature acoustique et dispose d'une protection cyber et d'une transmission cryptÃ©e (cryptage AES-256).
